value.title: Crew Worker Management
value.description: Certain types of workers, such as a crew foreman, can add new workers to the Statement of Work from the supplier’s existing workforce
value.businessvalues: Facilitate timely submission of time sheets and accurate invoicing
value.featuredetails: Within an Statement of Work engagement, there are cases, such as a construction project, when a worker is responsible for overseeing and completing these tasks. This worker, usually a crew foreman, manages a team, often submits time on their behalf, and is the first to know about any changes to the crew members. Now a crew foreman can add new workers to the Statement of Work from the supplier’s existing workforce.

value.title: Configurable Work Order Views
value.description: Work order views can be customized for user groups to control access to information.
value.businessvalues: By allowing a buyer to control the information a user can view on a work order, it simplifies user experience and builds data visibility controls.
value.featuredetails: An SAP Fieldglass Work Order contains all the necessary financial, cost, and job details to confirm an external worker’s assignment. Although all this data is required, some information may not be relevant for all users. Additionally, buyers may wish to restrict its view for certain roles. For example, a cost center owner may need to see financial data to approve a work order; however, in Germany, this information should be restricted from the view of the works council.

value.title: Rate Change Matrix Improvements
value.description: Additional options for automating a rate change with simplified implementation and maintenance processes.
value.businessvalues: The SAP Fieldglass automated rate change functionality, Rate Change Matrix, drives significant process efficiencies and financial gains within contingent workflows. The planned enhancements provide additional options for managing cost savings initiatives and simplifies the process of implementation and maintenance.
value.featuredetails: Two enhancements are being made to this functionality. First, the ability to define if the rate change is always determined from the original bill rate or from a cumulative change from the previous rate tier. Second, the ability to utilize multiple lookups to better organize data definition and avoid unnecessary data replication.

value.title: Planning Optimizations
value.description: Event-based optimization using business rules
value.businessvalues:
Define optimization targets with individual scoring functions that determine the suitability of an activity for a technician.

When absences overlap activities, the engine is triggering a re-scheduling of activities, via a business rule.
value.featuredetails: The optimization can be triggered by two types of events: time-based or on data change. The data change that can trigger the re-optimization can either be due to changes to technician availability because of a schedule overlapping with reservations or absences, or due to adding an additional activity. It can be specified what activities will be re-optimized when triggered through a SELECT statement. This enables you to very flexibly exclude or include activities for a specific optimization.
